newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil coffee co-op stocks 981,475 bags end-April.
newsitem.headline: Brazil coffee co-op stocks 981,475 bags end-April.

text.p: Coffee stocks held by Brazilian cooperatives totalled only 981,475 60.5 kg bags on April 30, the National Coffee Council (CNC) said in a statement.
This is down from than the 1.49 million bags held by cooperatives as of March 31 and also below the 1.34 million bags held at the end of April in 1996.
The fact stocks are lower at this stage than last year when producers were working with the frost and drought-hit 1995/96 crop shows the higher level of sales by producers, the CNC said.

Sales by cooperatives reached 609,063 bags in April versus 731,919 bags during March and 486,371 bags in April last year, showing that producers maintained the flow of coffee to the market, the CNC said.
Cooperatives received 104,011 bags of coffee during the month of April against 150,942 bags delivered the previous month and 70,170 bags received in April 1996, it added.
